answers.answer: Hello,In females urinary tract infection is one of the commonest causes of frequent urination. Get your urine examination and culture done to rule it out.It can also be due to many reasons which can be physiological or disease-related, and include excessive intake of liquids, diuretic substances (including tea, caffeine, alcohol, certain drugs), anxiety, exposure to cold, diabetes mellitus, diabetes insipidus (central or nephrogenic), or obstruction, etc to name a few more common ones. I suggest you to take opinion of your doctor who would do a clinical examination and advice for needful tests.I hope it helps. Take care and regards.

question: for the last 3 days or so I have urinated around 10 times a day (normally it's 3 or 4 for me) I also have an almost constant urge to urinate. I have no fever, infact when i measured my temp it was 97.5. i'm also not a big drinker, in a typical day i would have altogether maybe 2 small glasses of water and a cup of tea or a glass of milk. I havent  had an increase in the typical amount of fluids i take in daily in the last 3 days. problem is worst in the evenings. I have back pain but i have regular back muscle problems
title: frequent urination
